titleStmt.title: Edinburgh, May 14. 1679. Forasmuch as his Majesty by a proclamation of the fourth of this instant, did, for the horrid discovery of the murther of the late Archbishop of St. Andrews, require and command all the heretors and masters of Fyfe and Kinross, to being their tenents, cottars, and servants, and others dwelling on their lands, to the respective places and tyets therein mentioned ...
titleStmt.author: Scotland. Privy Council.
Scotland. Sovereign (1649-1685 : Charles II)

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the heir of Andrew Anderson, Printer to his most excellent Majesty,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and first lines of text.
Royal arms at head of text; initial letter.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
